author: Special Correspondent
text:
The 300-year-old chariot being used for the famous annual car festival of Kalpathy in Palakkad will get a makeover this year with the Kerala Tourism Department sanctioning Rs. 10 lakh for the purpose. The repair work will begin next month and will be completed by September for the Vellottam festival — a trial run of the celebrated car festival slated for November.

Talking to The Hindu , Kalpathy resident and Kerala Brahmana Sabha president Karimpuzha Raman said the amount was sanctioned following an application by the sabha to the government through Shafi Parambil, MLA. “The chariot was in disrepair for long. It was fast losing its sheen and a complete makeover was necessary,” said Mr. Raman.

Mr. Raman expressed hope that the District Tourism Promotion Council, through which the work will be taken up, will complete the repair in a time-bound manner. “We are grateful to the government for addressing our concern.
title: 300-year-old temple chariot in Kerala to get a makeover
